document_data.name: Sulphon
document_data.mainbody: '''Sulphon''' was a [[human]] [[sage]] inhabiting [[Waterdeep]] during the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: He was a quiet man who was dedicated to his studies and preferred to be left alone with his [[book]]s rather than deal with people.
document_data.Activities:
Sulphon specialized in lore dealing with [[magical beast]]s and [[aberration]]s. In his library, he owned an untitled book by [[Rhaphodel]], Sage of Sages, on the [[ecology]] of [[basilisk]]s.{{Cite dragon/81/Ecology of the Basilisk|27}} He also wrote on the rise of the Waterdhavian noble class.<ref>

Around [[1372 DR]], he was often doing research within the Great Library of the [[Font of Knowledge]], a temple to [[Oghma]] in the [[Waterdeep/Castle Ward|Castle Ward]].
